channel.title: My Personal Stock News

item.title: [AAPL] US futures edge higher and gold hits another record as markets swoon over Greenland dispute
item.description: Asian shares mostly extended their losses on Wednesday and gold prices hit a record high as concerns over U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff threats on Greenland fueled unease among investors. U.S. futures rose after steep losses Tuesday on Wall Street. Gold prices crossed the $4,800 mark for the first time, gaining 1.7% as money flowed into assets considered to be safe havens at times of uncertainty.

item.title: [INTC] Elon Musk Says He Hasn't Sold Tesla Stock For Over Three Years: 'Bought A Billion Dollars...'
item.description: Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk has shared that he has not sold any of the EV giant's stock in the past three years. Bought A Billion Dollars Worth Of Stock Responding to a now-deleted post by influencer Mario Nawfal on the social media platform X on Sunday, the billionaire shared that he hadn't "sold stock for about 3 years." item.title: [INTC] Global Stocks Trounce the S&P 500 in Trump’s Chaotic First Year
item.description: Measured against stock markets from Tokyo to Frankfurt to financial capitals across the developing world, though, the verdict on Trump’s return to the White House is decidedly less triumphal. In fact, equities worldwide — once the US is excluded — have risen around 30% since he took office a year ago, roughly double the S&P 500’s gain, according to MSCI’s index. Trump’s comparison with his predecessors is no better: As far as the S&P 500 goes, the first-year gain under Trump clocks in as only the ninth best start to a term since World War II, according to CFRA.

item.title: [BARC.L] How The Narrative Around Trimble (TRMB) Is Shifting With New Tech Tailwinds And Valuation Tweaks
item.description: Why Trimble’s Fair Value Moved, Even If Only Slightly Analysts have nudged their fair value estimate for Trimble from US$98.50 to US$99.75 while also adjusting the discount rate from 8.61% to 8.66% and trimming the revenue growth assumption from 6.52% to 6.43%. These fine tuning moves reflect how recent Street research is balancing Trimble’s exposure to areas like data centers, automation, electronics, test and measurement, and semiconductors against the execution challenges and broader...
